Brains mature through pruning

Last updated on April 7, 2021

It seems that even if neurogenesis is real, the brain mainly matures by pruning neurons and synapses performing poorly in terms of representational power. In essence, this indicates that a mature brain is defined by efficiency and increased signal-to-noise ratio, especially in frontal areas. However, cognitive decline might reverse the process.
